oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-05 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 5, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Sam & Kirk McGee, Pap's Jug Band, the Crook Brothers, Robert Lunn, the John Daniel Quartet, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Robert Lunn; John Daniel Quartet; Mac McGar
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys and Girls -- The Great Speckled Bird (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces Robert Lunn -- Mama Don't Allow No Music (Robert Lunn) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces the John Daniel Quartet -- Rock Of Ages Hide Thou Me (John Daniel Quartet) -- Louie Buck talks -- War Bonds P.S.A. (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar -- Wake Up Susan (Mac McGar) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- ['John Daniel Quartet' re-transfers]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D.
